News

February half-term events at Suffolk Libraries

Written by Alice Violett · Published Feb 4, 2020

Children and families are invited to meet animals and princesses, learn about the natural world, make arts and crafts and more this half-term.

Enjoy a magical book night with Suffolk Libraries

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Jan 28, 2020

Harry Potter Book Night is back this February. Libraries across Suffolk will once again be hosting events in celebration of the bestselling books by J. K. Rowling.

Suffolk Libraries and Suffolk Wildlife Trust get wild about reading

Written by James Powell · Published Jan 21, 2020

Suffolk Wildlife Trust and Suffolk Libraries are launching a new partnership project to connect the natural world and the written word and celebrate the different ways authors relate to nature.

Ipswich conference aims to help leading businesses tackle mental health issues

Written by James Powell · Published Jan 17, 2020

A conference to help businesses in the region tackle the issue of poor mental health in the workplace is taking place in Ipswich on Monday 30 March.

Ten ways to beat Blue Monday at your local library

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Jan 17, 2020

Monday 20 January 2020 is known as Blue Monday - considered the most depressing day of the year. Why not boost your mood by visiting a library?

Lesley’s Readers on BBC Radio Suffolk – book choice for February 2020

Written by Alice Violett · Published Jan 17, 2020

This month Lesley will be discussing Reasons to be Cheerful, by Nina Stibbe.

Great Cornard Library access improvements

Written by James Powell · Published Jan 13, 2020

The main entrance to Great Cornard Library is out of use until March for construction work to improve disabled access. Customers can enter the library through Great Cornard Leisure Centre and Gainsborough Coffee House.

Halesworth Library to create memorial garden for late manager Ali Hopkins

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Jan 7, 2020

A memorial garden is being planned at Halesworth Library in honour of much-loved Ali Hopkins, who managed the library up until her death in January 2019.

Kessingland and Rosehill libraries to change opening hours

Written by Alice Violett · Published Jan 2, 2020

Following recent consultations with customers, Kessingland and Rosehill libraries will be changing their opening hours from Monday 3 February. Both libraries' total number of opening hours will remain the same.

10 ways to jumpstart your January with Suffolk Libraries

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Dec 27, 2019

Throughout the first month of 2020, we're running Jumpstart January, a month-long celebration of everything our libraries do to improve your wellbeing. Here are just ten of the ways you can boost your mood across the county this winter.
